intro: Hieracium junciniforme, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with slender, grass-like stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, often resembling those of other hawkweed species. Hieracium junciniforme is known for its ability to thrive in moist, disturbed soils, making it a common sight in meadows and along stream banks.
